msContents.summary: Record of money taxes in the first document with names of individuals with amounts of money taxes; also a loan account and names of individuals credited with payments of various charges out of the proceeds of loans; in the second document there is a sitologos account, with a list of names with amounts of wheat, barley, and lentils

msItem.note: Written across the fibers; on the front P.Col. V 1 recto 6
The first hand writes regular cursives with enlargement of initials; the second writes larger and more irregular letters
In the first 4 cols. very large interlinear spaces appear between some of the entries for the possible insertion of additional taxpayers
Certain names and amounts were removed from the list, in consequence of later findings
The headings of some accounts are not uniformly written: some are in smaller letters than usual and appear almost as marginal notations
The date is given on the basis of internal evidence and the best clue is offered by the date of the garden taxes
In the first document 24 names of women appear, of which 2 were deleted
The last col. is so rubbed and tattered that no complete entries can be read

138 lines of writing divided into 9 cols. and including 2 unrelated documents, which were written in different hands and occupy respectively cols. 1-8 (with cols. numbers) and col. 9 (without col. number)

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,6 (Lot II) in Bell
